rationale: Screen reader users cannot determine the purpose of icon-only buttons without accessible labels. This is a WCAG 2.1 Level A violation (Success Criterion 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value) affecting the entire application. It blocks accessibility compliance and excludes users with visual disabilities.
problemSolved: IconButton components render icon-only buttons (e.g., <IconButton><CloseIcon /></IconButton>) without aria-label props. Some have title attributes (e.g., title='Delete') which are not reliably read by screen readers. The notification bell in Header.tsx (line 103), password visibility toggles in LoginPage.tsx (lines 277, 337), close buttons in Modal.tsx and AnimatedModal.tsx, carousel prev/next in TestimonialsCarousel.tsx (lines 276, 310), and all action buttons in data tables (edit, delete, view) across 30+ files are inaccessible to assistive technology.
